Posted By: nammertime (12/2/2009 10:24:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"Oh my God, I just wiped the board with [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment)! I'mma drop my bomb and wi-"  
  
"Wretched Banquet."  
  
"FFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUU-"  
  
Hilarious theories abound. A much better card at second glance, and while it looks rubbish on paper, removal is removal.  
  
And the flavor text is blunt, direct, and absolutely hilarious IMO.
posts.html:
"Oh my God, I just wiped the board with Day of Judgment! I'mma drop my bomb and wi-"

"FFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUU-"

Posted By: CogMonocle (8/20/2013 10:24:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I have a soft spot for this card. Conflux was my first draft and really the first set I really started playing. This card and [Bone Splinters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bone Splinters) were two of the first removal spells I got to use and now I appreciate them much more. I'm glad Liliana brought [Bone Splinters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bone Splinters) back for us.
posts.html:
I have a soft spot for this card. Conflux was my first draft and really the first set I really started playing. This card and Bone Splinters were two of the first removal spells I got to use and now I appreciate them much more. I'm glad Liliana brought Bone Splinters back for us.

As a few have said before, it's a lot better then it looks.
  
   
I threw this into a control deck with some edicts and thought, "What the hell, it probably won't be very good but i'll try it." This card is amazingly useful... especially if you don't plan on having many creatures out the first three or four turns.
